1.text: At this, my heart became frightened, and it has been moved from its place.

2.text: Pay close attention to the alarm of his voice and to the sound that proceeds from his mouth.

3.text: He beholds everything under the heavens, and his light reaches beyond the ends of the earth.

4.text: After this, a noise will sound; he will thunder with the voice of his greatness, and it will not be tracked down, yet his voice will be obeyed.

5.text: God will thunder with his voice miraculously, for he performs great and unsearchable things.

6.text: He commands the snow to descend on earth, and the winter rains, and the shower of his strength.

7.text: He signs the hand of all men, so that each one may know his works.

8.text: The beast will enter his hiding-place, and he will remain in his cave.

9.text: From the interior, a storm will come forth, and a cold winter from the north.

10.text: As God breathes out, frost forms, and the waters are poured forth very widely again.

11.text: Crops desire clouds, and the clouds scatter their light.

12.text: It shines all around, wherever the will of him that governs them will lead, to anywhere he will command, over the whole face of the earth,

13.text: whether in one tribe, or in his own region, or in whatever place of his mercy that he will order them to be found.

14.text: Listen to these things, Job. Stand up and consider the wonders of God.

15.text: Do you know when God ordered the rains, so as to show the light of his clouds?

16.text: Do you know the great paths of the clouds, and the perfect sciences?

17.text: Are not your garments hot, when the south wind blows across the land?

18.text: Perhaps you have made the heavens with him, which are very solid, as if they had been cast from brass.

19.text: Reveal to us what we should say to him, for, of course, we are wrapped in darkness.

20.text: Who will explain to him the things that I am saying? Even while a man is still speaking, he will be devoured.

21.text: Although they do not see the light, the air will be thickened suddenly into clouds, and the wind, passing by, will drive them away.

22.text: Riches arrive from the north, and fearful praise reaches out to God.

23.text: We are not worthy to be able to find him. Great in strength, great in judgment, great in justice: he is indescribable.

24.text: Therefore, men will fear him, and all those who seem to themselves to be wise, will not dare to contemplate him.
